info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 28 at 2:00PM PDT until March 29 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, with localized amounts up to 15 inches, are expected. * WHERE...The snow level will fall from around 7000 feet this afternoon, to 5500 feet late tonight. The strongest winds will be near the ridge tops and along the desert slopes through early this evening. * WHEN...Until 8 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times due to fog and blowing snow. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are occurring. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
